subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit 4.9 released!
msgSnippet: That s an interesting one... I ve got a project where I ve pushed milestone releases into Maven Central in recent months (e.g. as 1.0.0.M1 , M2 ). I guess a
messageBody:
That's an interesting one...

I've got a project where I've pushed milestone releases into Maven
Central in recent months (e.g. as 1.0.0.M1 , M2 ).

I guess a beta is a different story as the beta releases and final
release should only differ in any bugs being fixed, not in terms of
features.

It'll be interesting to when my beta cycle starts (with 1.0.0.RC1) :)



On 25/08/2011 22:12, Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> On Thu, Aug 25, 2011 at 7:45 AM, sschroev<stephan202@...> wrote:
>
>> W.r.t. your last question: as far as I could tell the beta versions were
>> indeed not available in Maven central;
>
> As far as I know, beta versions are never allowed in Maven Central, you need
> to use the beta repository (and tell your pom to point there).
>
